tags.name: catalogs and bibliographies
tags.description: Lists of published works about asexuality.

tags.name: communities and community spaces
tags.description: Current and former online and offline spaces where asexual people connect.

tags.name: histories and timelines
tags.description: Historical accounts of the asexual community and how it has changed over time.

tags.name: news coverage
tags.description: News coverage about asexuality and the asexual community.

tags.name: newsjournals and underground press
tags.description: Underground, indie, and alternative publications that cover asexuality.

tags.name: terms and where they came from
tags.description: The origins of terms and labels used by the asexual community.

tags.name: asexual
tags.description: Often defined as someone who does not experience sexual attraction.

tags.name: aromantic
tags.description: Often defined as someone who does not experience romantic attraction.

tags.name: quoiromantic
tags.description: Often defined as someone who does not differentiate between romantic and platonic attraction, also called WTFromantic.

tags.name: wtfromantic
tags.description: Often defined as someone who does not differentiate between romantic and platonic attraction, also called Quoiromantic.

tags.name: celibate
tags.description: Someone who does not or is not engaging in sexual activity, different from asexuality.

tags.name: demisexual
tags.description: Often defined as someone who needs a strong emotional connection before experiencing sexual attraction.

tags.name: gray-asexual
tags.description: Often defined as someone who experiences sexual attraction infrequently or only under specific circumstances.

tags.name: intersex
tags.description: Someone born with physical characteristics that do not fit typical binary notions of male or female bodies, different from gender identity.

tags.name: non-binary
tags.description: Someone whose gender identity exists outside the man/woman gender binary.

tags.name: queerplatonic
tags.description: Often defined as a relationship that has a high level of emotional intimacy and commitment but is not romantic.

tags.name: transgender
tags.description: Someone whose gender identity is different from the one typically associated with the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: transsexual
tags.description: An outdated term for a transgender person. This term was once used by the trans community, but is no longer considered appropriate.

tags.name: transvestite
tags.description: An outdated term for someone who crossdresses. In the past, this was sometimes used to refer to trans people, different from crossdressing. This term was once used by the trans community, but is no longer considered appropriate.
